page.title: 03** SCHOLES AND BARWICK **
page.content: {Working on the Domesday Project} We visited the Buffers at Scholes. It has changed from being a railway station with trains going to York, Scarborough, Malton, Hull and Doncaster, to being a pub and restaurant. Most of the land around was grass and farm land with just a few houses and pubs. Another site of interest we saw was the Barwick in Elmet Maypole. It was about two times as high as our school maypole and it has got some bells which seem to be made out of flower petals. We also did four wall charts. One of what we have in our streets, where our parents shop and how far it is to places, and three amenities charts.We have one map of the area we have to cover in this survey. {By Michael Slip. Aged 9. {St. Gregory's Primary School.
